author: SlothRogen
body:
Some highlights from the president's afternoon address:

* "I'm glad to see that you're practicing social distancing. That's very good."
* "Avoid gathering in groups of more than 10 people"
* "Avoid discretionary travel"
* "Avoid eating and drinking at public restaurants, bars, and food courts."
* "We will defeat the virus... and... we're going to have a big celebration... all together."
* "A lot of progress has been made."
* "Our government is prepared to do whatever it takes. Whatever it takes, we're doing."
* "The only thing we have right now is the ingenuity of the American people." (said by the doctor)
* “We’ll hold the death down to a level that is… much better than the other way… had we not done a good job.”
* Reporter: “Is this the new normal until the summer?” Trump: “They think until July or August”
* Reporter: “People are very scared.” Trump: “I think they see we’re doing a fantastic job.”
* “Someday soon hopefully it will end”
* “We heard about reports from China that something is happening…”
* “I think that what we do… I’ve spoken actually with my son… how bad is this? It’s bad. But we’re going for a best case.”
* “I wouldn’t say the restaurant business is booming.”
* “We’re ordering gloves, masks…I think, Mike, we have a lot?”
* “We’re taking over buildings that aren’t used.”
* “If you’re talking about the virus, no, that’s not under control.”
* “I think there’s a tremendous pent up demand, bot in terms of the stock market and the economy.
* “We have a problem that nobody ever thought about… 1917…1918. This is a bad one. A very bad one. It’s so contagious. Record setting contagion.”
* “Very, very bad for older people. Especially older people with problems.”
* “I think the media has been very fair…” (<— Who is this new president?!)
* “We’ve told the airlines we’re gonna help them. We’re gonna be backstopping the airlines… it’s not their fault”
* “Once this virus is gone I think you’re gonna have a stock market like you’ve never seen before”
* Reporter: “On a scale of 1-10 how would you rate your response to this crisis?” Trump: “I’d rate it a 10.’
* “The market will take care of itself.”

author: mililani
body:
I saw the reversal mid after noon and was like, ok, looks like the market is coming back from this.  Found it was the Fed announce 1.5 trillion USD of liquidity injections.  Then the market went *BAM*, fuck you FEDS!  We're sick of your bullshit!  And dropped back down and closed by another -1300 pts! 

If you haven't been paying attention, that's some scary shit!  The Fed had an emergency meeting and dropped a 50 bps cut.  Then it expanded repo market operations from 100 to 150 to 175 billion dollars in a few weeks.  And now they announced 1.5 trillion USD of liquidity injections, and the market just steam rolled RIGHT past that.  Just like, "Yeah, fuck you this time.  You guys ain't gonna do shit!"  If that doesn't make you wake up and realize this is WAY different than 07/08, you need to get your head outta your ass.  No amount of gov't intervention is going to rescue this market now.

author: dopexile
body:
At this point, I think the Fed would be wiser to relax and remain calm. When everyone sees the Fed panic it is going to create more panic.

They couldn't even wait until the FOMC meeting. They had to have 2 emergency rate cuts. That tells you they know shit is 100x worse than they are letting on. 

They are out of ammo now too. What can they do next? Negative interest rates? That already failed in Europe. 2 Trillion of QE? That would probably make it obvious there is no end to their madness and lead to massive inflation.

I love the "full range of tools". 

* Tool A: run the printing press.
* Tool B: run the printing press with 24-hour shifts.
* Tool C: run the printing press at the highest speed settings.

author: JLTLJ5
body:
This is honestly so short sighted. 

I'm 99.9% sure I will outperform my 401k with my private investment fund during this crazy time. 

This virus has the processionals scrambling trying to figure out the end game. The panic is personal since it has a chance to effect our health. When was the last time millions(or billions) were all effected by one nasty virus. 

I pulled my personal stock investments on that little bump we had on Wednesday and have gained those losses from Thursday to Tuesday by buying cheap puts last Friday that were up over 100%  . I now have a shopping list to make sure my investments grow even stronger from here on out. 

Ps- I also held onto some puts over the weekend just in case things got ugly. I was around in 2008 and I promised myself I would never lose on another opportunity like 2008. I'm keeping that promise. 

Lastly, if you were watching the pros, most didn't want to touch this market to until middle of this week. 

I agree with them. I'll start adding after the next leg down and start going long.

body:
All valid, except one thing.

The market's reaction to Europe's situation priced in the fears of something similar happening to USA, adjusted by likelihood of it occurring.

As Corona spreads and it's impacts are revealed (as more people die, schools/businesses close, events close), the market will continue to revise future guidance.

That is why if the situation gets worse, then further downtrend follows. The market has priced in the likelihood of things going to shit, which now became even more likely given recent deaths and food run panics @ Seattle's Costcos.

Unless you're seriously proposing that recent deaths and potential economic stand still from city wide quarantine have already been priced in by the markets? Fuck no.

Again I’m a noob so I might not be the right person to ask but ya your right. You want 

1. High volume
2. High implies vol 
3. Something with date far enough out to not get screwed.

That’s how people post stupid 12000% gains sometimes. My two other contracts I bought a little closer to the money to see if the gains would be proportional. They are not as of yet, we will see what Monday brings.

Again, I could be way off but that seems to be working as of now for me. Of course if the market goes up I’m so far OTM that nothing will bring it back, if I was ITM or ATM I could still recover.

author: cassiusclayd
body: It really doesn't matter if the mortality and infection rates are the same with modern treatments. Hard stop. Mortality rates reflect the effectiveness of treatment on the virus. Look at Iran for an example of how deadly this virus would have been in the early 1900s. **Dramatically** more lethal than the Spanish Flu. It's not now *because of* intubation and other modern treatments for pneumonia. Steady state, this virus is far more lethal than the Spanish Flu was as we currently estimate.

author: ATL_LAX
body:
Do you have any idea that analysts have been talking about this since January 23rd?

Many have already stated 0% GDP growth in China Q1, other cite negative GDP growth.

Then markets thought it was only a China issue so they relaxed a bit

Europe got hit and they started to panic. This wasn’t a normal drop this was one of the best drops to be a bear.

Now shits priced in man, Sunday is a new day, I’ll wait until it’s news cycle, but so far everything is pretty tame and exactly what the market expected for over the weekend.

The US economy is 75% domestic and 70% of our economic activity is based on consumer activity, so I agree if shit gets wild over here. then we might be in for some trouble.

You understand the countries that entered recession were already in track right? The virus just expedited shit.

You understand that even with taking into account the global impact, China’s GDP growth and the US GDP growth has only slowed down. Until Q1 numbers (which are already beet bearish) I don’t expect much to happen other then choppy volatile days.

author: long_AMZN
body:
Monday will be green. It was no mystery that US had coronavirus cases. And nobody thought that somehow Americans are immune to coronavirus. UK had their first death couple of days ago, and so US death comes as no surprise. Everyone had it in their model a week ago.

You know what everyone didn't have in their model a week ago? A 50bp fed cut. On Monday Asia will rally hard off it's Fridays close, catching up with the US close - setting stage for continuation of the fed rally. I feel sorry for you poor shmucks who are gonna lose your ass on the puts, but at the same time the Pikachu faces you'll be making would be hilarious to see. 

Last chance to understand:
Think about how the situation changes from Friday morning to today. 

Morning:

-knew first US death will be any day now
-didnt know fed would be delivering 50bp cut

Today:

-first us death happened, couple days after first UK death, as predicted
-JPow makes a special statement that basically confirms the cut and perhaps it even could be a double cut-50bp

Did the narrative get more bearish, or bullish?

By the way, I'm with you guys. I also would love to load up on $1500 AMZN. But it's time to accept the reality and look for a better short re-entry. Dont revenge trade

author: Summebride
body:
Lots of tech has been cut by 20%, and a lot of these techs don't make money and *still* have sky high multiples.

Then I look at VMWARE.  It's a quiet company, their product is used everywhere by almost all big enterprises.  They make money, they're affiliated/insulated by their Dell relationship. 

Yet it's now selling for almost **half** of its 2019 high, with multiple of just 7.5

author: Cracker77
body:
not exactly what you're asking for, and out of date, but related: [https://blogs.wsj.com/economics/2014/10/27/who-owns-stocks-its-not-just-the-rich/](https://blogs.wsj.com/economics/2014/10/27/who-owns-stocks-its-not-just-the-rich/)

The group with the highest percentage owning stock was 55+ (and since this was 2014, they'd be 60+ now). 

They have the most reason to sell because of the combined factors of having the least time for the market to recover, and having the most risk from the disease. So they have both the largest amount of stock and the most reason to sell it.

I wouldn’t want to buy puts now simply because the Fed would have me by the balls if I did and could choose to rip them off anytime. author: DoubleTroble
body:
To friends, I tell them what I would have done in their shoes. I always lean towards the safer option, if they gain money I'm obviously happy for them. I leave the decision to them since losing money could break a friendship.

Giving friends advice in life, is what friends are for. If you advice makes them earn money, be happy for them. I'm sorry if you envy them, this is something you have to deal with yourself.

People are good at different stuff, they most certain have skills they can pay you back. Maybe they already did and you did not value their skill as high as yours. It's hard to beat a 30% gain on a huge capital with fixing a car. But a friend driving miles to help you when your car is broke can mean a lot. 

I had friends which never do anything in return. They actually only call when they want advice or something done. Some people are extremely selfish, sorry bro. But you already did a huge part in this, which is realizing who they are. Now you gotta make  the decision. Are they worth the things you pay (advice in stocks?) for maybe, their stories?. If the answer is no get rid of them, otherwise get your shit together and stop thinking you are so much better.

author: FrankOfTomPads
body:
Hey guys, 

I don't know if this is the right place, but we own a facility that manufactures n95 masks (and on approx. March 15th, we'll also produce surgical masks) in China (Zaozhuang, Shandong specifically). We have a 500,000sq ft facility with a dedicated ISO class 5 Cleanroom for our 300,000 daily n95 production capabilities (and 1MM masks a day for surgical masks once it's at full operation) and we are taking bulk orders (10,000 pc minimum) for shipment within China, our clients are usually in charge of export as there simply isn't enough time for our limited employees to deal with exports. We supply to one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in China called XiuZheng pharmaceutical group 修正集团 and have sold millions of our n95 respirators to them. We also supply millions of n95 respirators to Xiaomi 小米, the phone company. We've had clients export to Russia, HK and US, though I'm not quite sure the exact logistics they went through. Some clients use freight forwarding companies.

The material costs have tripled in the last month alone so our masks are currently more expensive than usual, but people are nonstop purchasing due to the shortages. Hopefully we can help you get what you're looking for.  

Our current pricing for n95 mask is 14rmb ($2 USD equivalent) for smaller orders of 10,000pcs+, 13 rmb ($1.86) for 50,000+, 12 rmb ($1.72) for 100,000pcs+, 11rmb ($1.57) for 1,000,000+ and 10rmb for 10,000,000+. This does not include shipping cost by SF Express which will be Cash on Delivery. It also does not include 10% taxes if applicable. Please keep in mind that material prices are constantly shifting so this may be out of date when you see this. Just two weeks ago (2/12/2020) our price per N95 mask was 18rmb while our prices in January was 4rmb! Once materials run out we cannot purchase them unless we pay a crazy amount for example, one ton of raw material used to cost 20,000 rmb, now for the same ton of n95 material costs 380,000-800,000 rmb, which is literally up to 40 times the cost for the same exact material. There is a global shortage of n95 grade materials.

Please don't hesitate to contact me on Wechat or Whatsapp if you want to place orders. 

My Wechat ID is: franktsaur and my WhatsApp ID is +16269916596. I am based in Los Angeles, but I work with the Asia team remotely. 

Sincerely, 
Frank T.

author: lordoneill
body:
Great posts guys. 

Haven’t posted before. Got back last week from New York had a ball and we were joking about Corona virus. My portfolio mostly Nasdaq shares going well. This week in Ireland no joke. Fear everywhere. So I think Warren Buffett said rule 1 in investing is don’t loose money and rule 2 is see rule 1. So when you guys states side start to see what’s happening I believe there will be more fear your side hence more selling.

So I liquidated everything on Friday because 
1. I think you ain’t seen nothing yet in the USA re the Corona Virus (I hope I am wrong)
2. A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush. So in cash now ( I have had a good run and can’t complain)
3. The is real fear out there . Rugby Matches being cancelled, conferences, first reported case of Corona in Dublin yesterday.
4. I am a long term investor and will be back in again when this passes and it will pass. I am hopping by the Summer.

I think long term you will all be fine.

Take care guys. Interesting week(s) ahead.
